message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SD

Reasoning: 
- cs.CL (Computational Linguistics): The paper deals with analyzing humor in text, specifically in the form of captions for cartoons. This falls under the purview of computational linguistics.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper discusses automatic methods for selecting the funniest caption, which involves machine learning and natural language processing techniques. This makes it relevant to the AI community.
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper uses machine learning methods to analyze and select the funniest captions, which makes it relevant to the machine learning community.
- cs.CV (Computer Vision): The paper mentions the possibility of extending the analysis to multimodal systems that involve both text and vision. This makes it relevant to the computer vision community.
- cs.SD (Sound): Although not explicitly mentioned in the abstract, humor can also be conveyed through sound. Therefore, this paper could potentially be relevant to the sound community as well.
